summary:
Zeger van der Wal (1977) is a globally recognized speaker, scholar, and consultant in public management and leadership. Currently, he is a Senior Fellow at the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy, based at Asia’s no. 1 university NUS. Zeger is also Professor by special appointment at Leiden University. He has won several research and teaching awards and (co)authored over 130 publications in top-tier academic journals, books, magazines and newspapers. His latest book is The 21st Century Public Manager.

Zeger manages an active consulting and executive education portfolio with over 75 assignments in 25 countries to date. Recent clients include the World Economic Forum, VISA, Toyota, GIZ, UNDP, Civil service College Singapore, Monetary Authority Singapore, Ayala Corporation, the Korean Standards Association, the Indian Economic Service, ANZSOG, RANEPA, and Hungary National Bank. He regularly keynotes at major conferences and events

Van der Wal has educated and trained over 3500 professional graduate students and senior officials across the globe. His work has taken him to Australia, China, Finland, Hong Kong SAR, Hungary, India, Kazakhstan, Malaysia, Oman, Qatar, Russia, Singapore, Thailand, The Netherlands, UAE, UK, and USA. He has held visiting fellowships at American University and The Maxwell School of Citizenship and Public Affairs in the USA, and Australia National University.  

Top-tier journals which have published his work include Public Administration Review, Public Administration, International Public Management Journal, Administration & Society, American Review of Public Administration, Public Management Review, and Journal of Business Ethics. His main publications have been translated into Russian and Chinese. Zeger sits on the editorial board of 8 international journals and book series.
